intro: Stylidium simulans, commonly known as the mimic buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble those of the buttercup. The plant has a short, erect stem with few leaves, and its flowers are typically arranged in a single cluster at the top. Stylidium simulans is a perennial herb that thrives in sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. It is known for its ability to mimic other plants, which may aid in its survival by deterring herbivores.
